title: Pixel 3 Warranty Incorrect When Purchased from Amazon.com
content:
Brand New Factory Sealed Pixel 3 Warranty Incorrect When Purchased from Amazon.com (shipped and sold by Amazon not a 3rd party seller).  I purchased 10/31/2019, contacted support to verify warranty and they say it expires 9/15/2020.  Here is Google Support's response:

Clay
5:02 PM
As per our records the device warranty expires on Sep 15, 2020. If you have any question about the warranty please contact your point of purchase.

Clay
5:06 PM
The warranty of the retailer and Google will differ from retailer to retailer. However, the warranty of the device from our end is covered until Sep 15, 2020.

Contacted Amazon Support just to see what they said:

Mary | Customer Service
That is right and we have a 30 days return policy.
Google Support says it has a year warranty if they can honor the warranty,please contact the manufacturer if they can replace the item.
If in case there is a problem you encounter on the phone.
Or you can buy the protection plan.
Here is the link:
https://www.amazon.com/s?k=protection+plan+for+electronics&crid=1BXOQLWXHO9Q3&sprefix=protection+pla%2Caps%2C491&ref=nb_sb_ss_i_3_14

So Amazon doesn't seem to care if the manufacturer (Google in this case) doesn't honor their warranty.  They just say buy a warranty for it.  So it doesn't seem like Google or Amazon Support knows what is going on.  Not pleased with Google's Support as it seems to be non existent if you don't purchase it from the Google Store directly.
